page.title: 14TRANSPORT FAIRLIGHT E.SUSSEX
page.content:
In the Fairlight, Guestling, Pett area of East Sussex, there is one main road, the A.259 from Hastings through Guestling to Rye. Two other roads are just wide enough for two buses to pass each other, the remaining roads being very narrow, winding country lanes. There are only pavements along the roads in the centre of the villages.
The l98l Census showed that car ownership is high: Fairlight 76.76%, Guestling 78.2% and Pett 75.27%. There are four garages in this area to service these vehicles. Four star petrol costs Â£2.04p per gallon here.
The nearest railway stations are 3 miles to the west at Ore, Hastings, or 8 miles to the east at Rye, from where trains travel north to London, west to Eastbourne and east to Ashford, Kent.
